DOC.brief_summary: Respiratory distress syndrome ( RDS ) newborn , also call hyaline membrane disease , common cause respiratory distress premature infant , correlate structural functional lung immaturity . The pathophysiology RDS complex . Immature type II alveolar cell produce less surfactant cause increase alveolar surface tension decrease compliance . This resultant atelectasis lead pulmonary vascular constriction , hypoperfusion , lung tissue ischemia . RDS prolong ventilation associate systemic/lung injury may also contribute long term oxygen dependency may result bronchopulmonary dysplasia ( BPD ) . Vitamin D fat-soluble steroid hormone primarily contribute maintenance normal calcium homeostasis skeletal mineralization . In addition classical role bone metabolism , vitamin D deficiency associate impaired pulmonary function , increase incidence viral bacterial infection inflammatory lung disease . Although exact mechanism fully understood , vitamin D appear impact variety inflammatory structural cell within lung include macrophage , lymphocytes epithelial cell . To best knowledge , study evaluate effect vitamin D level severity presence RDS preterm infant . Therefore , aim study evaluate possible role maternal/neonatal vitamin D level RDS development preterm infant . We also aim determine possible association maternal/neonatal vitamin D level incidence BPD neonatal morbidity .
DOC.brief_title: The Effect Maternal Neonatal Vitamin D Levels Respiratory Distress Syndrome Preterm Infants
DOC.detailed_description: Preterm infant respiratory distress < 37 week gestational age admit Neonatal Intensive Care Unit Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training Research Hospital include prospective study . Blood neonatal maternal vitamin D level obtain infant mother time hospital admission . The infant evaluate RDS surfactant requirement . If RDS need mechanical ventilation , intubate give surfactant , necessary . The maternal neonatal demographic infant record . Infants also follow term morbidity include patent ductus arteriosus , necrotizing enterocolitis , retinopathy prematurity , especially BPD . Then infant divide three group accord maternal/neonatal vitamin D level ( mild , moderate severe vitamin D deficiency ) group comparison perform Plasmas separate stored -80 C. Levels 25-OHD determine use Shimadzu LC-20AT model High Performance Liquid Chromatography ( HPLC ) system . Data analyze use SPSS software appropriate statistical analysis perform .
DOC.criteria: Preterm infant < 37 week gestational age admit Neonatal Intensive Care Unit Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training Research Hospital Preterm infants clinical laboratory finding RDS presence maternal clinical and/or histological chorioamnionitis , presence premature rupture membrane ( PROM ) , refusal parental consent , lack laboratory data , major congenital abnormality
DOC.keyword: vitamin D , prematurity , RDS , BPD , maternal , neonatal
